revised_title: Distribution and Species Variation in Comatulids
tldr: The author examines the distribution and species variation of Comatulids, a type of marine echinoderm, focusing on specimens collected by the "Challenger" expedition. They find that most species have limited geographical ranges and are primarily found in tropical and temperate zones. The author also discusses the rarity of Comatulids in deep-sea environments and compares their distribution to that of other crinoid species.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Marine Biology
